intro: Myosurus gracilis, commonly known as slender mouse-ear, is a small, herbaceous plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its delicate, hairy stems and small, clustered leaves that resemble mouse ears. The plant produces small, white flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Myosurus gracilis is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. It is often used in ecological restoration projects due to its ability to stabilize soil and support local wildlife.
